text: @ramraiding Praying for governance + HyperEVM in January but a reasonable guess would be sometime in Q1.

To help ring in the new year, I updated the graphic of Hyperliquid's history. The growth we've seen from 2023 to 2024 is incredible:
- TVL up ~2200x
- HLP PnL up ~50x
- Platform vol up ~1000x
- OI ATH up ~562x

2024 put Hyperliquid on the map. 2025 will be the year it takes over! https://t.co/0kc8QoA9Ti

This is not an indictment of sellers. Just a reminder that you should identify if you're a short term trader or long term believer and act accordingly.

Hyperliquid has hit $1T in all time volume with just a niche USDC bridge on Arbitrum.

Can you imagine what will happen when native bridges from BTC/ETH/SOL open up? When native spot assets from those chains become tradable on Hyperliquid?

For most of 2024, Hyperliquid incentivized holding spot tokens. If there's still incentives, consider the team rewarding users staking HYPE to secure the network.

Staked HYPE reduces supply while the AF gives perpetual demand. Jeff could be tipping the supply vs demand scales. https://t.co/024RpLZDdX

@Insayneth @MessariCrypto Glad you caught the prediction being built on FDV comps. It just doesn't make sense because the current float is materially not going to change for the next 12 months.

Crazy hoops are being jumped through.

Unsurprisingly, the analyst betting on a FTM -> Sonic L1 revival trade thinks Hyperliquid's outperformance against BTC is climaxing.

FWIW, it's not the craziest prediction if the cycle top occurs in mid 2025. But there does seem to be some level of discrediting HL's potential. https://t.co/RTAE1Qvv2c
@defidegen22 Nothing has been open sourced yet.

@dtvelectronics Hyperliquid is not built on Arbitrum. Arbitrum is just the only bridge to HL (for now).

More info in the docs if you are interested to read: https://t.co/HK7hJw1yzh

Hyperliquid's first daily distribution of staking rewards just went out!

As the APR suggests, it's not a huge amount at ~2.4% annually. How does everyone feel about what they received? https://t.co/hnh9xjOqqc

Expanding on this a bit: imagine if validators re-routed Hyperliquid's platform fees from buying back HYPE to just streaming the fees directly to HYPE stakers?

How would you feel if you woke up one day and see your USDC spot balance incrementally increasing by itself like this? https://t.co/mKxlQiBC6A
@mikocryptonft The team hasn't commented on this but it's entirely possible (and likely).

One of Hyperliquid's main critiques is that it's a CEX and not a DEX.

HYPE staking + expanded validator set is the start for HL to be a decentralized L1 blockchain. For some, this may not matter. But for those who care about crypto ethos, it's a fundamental step for HL's future.
@10TCoded @0xDildMoto Yes, 2 steps totaling 8 days in total.
@hushky6 I should have used a different word, like "can" instead of "will" to be more clear. Can't edit it now, unfortunately.
@hushky6 https://t.co/rOfnKHnFVH
Docs are here if you want to read yourself: https://t.co/ehRLWByFW9

Just read the Hyperliquid staking docs, TLDR here:
- Depositing to stake is instant
- Unstaking takes 1 day + 7 days to transfer back to spot wallet
- Rewards distro'd once a day, auto compounds
- Team will slash bad behaving nodes on discretion
- 2.37% APR @ 400M tokens staked
@dayze2much They are two completely different things. The HLP vault lets you market make against traders. Staking HYPE helps you decentralize the network.

@0x_antifragile I would say sub 3% is lower than I expected as well.

It's a bit too early to say whether it will impact LSTs or not. Governance is a meme in every other crypto project but I think governance will be a legitimate reason why people end up staking HYPE.

https://t.co/B7VdS5BN2S

@sarthakC0 The commission rates for most nodes have begun the race to zero, and I expect this to continue to happen over time.

I staked with over 10 different nodes because the point of decentralization the network is to have as many validators proposing blocks as possible.

Did you really think the Hyperliquid team wouldn't have network decentraliation + HYPE staking out in 2024? 😉

@_GrandExchange_ Must have been rough watching SOL go to $250 that same year lol

@0xFamus There are indeed many fundamental differences between HYPE now and SOL in 2021.

Usage on Hyperliquid is much larger, but also no CEX listings so there is more friction to buy. Also infinitely more crime on SOL, just to name a few.

@typicalsats The 2021 SOL run topped at around 80b circulating mcap.

That is a 9x from here, which is a similar multiple if HYPE went to $250.

If you think HYPE already peaked after trading for 30 days, understand that many are still sidelined. This includes even the most well known CT traders.

Last cycle, SOL went from $2 -> $250 in 11 months. All you had to do was buy and wait. Is that in your skillset?

@26Edlyn @HyperliquidX December Hyperliquid points are going to hit different.

Have we not learned that VC funding does not indicate token success? If anything, it’s a counter signal.

Hyperliquid rejected VC funding and the effect it had on the token price is reflected in the chart.

Building something with PMF is the first thing anyone should check for.

The early Solana whale has now purchased ~50m of HYPE the past couple days and you’re still waiting for sub $20 to buy?

Hyperliquid

The notorious Hyperliquid seller the past few days has sold most of his inventory from his sell wallet.

So what happens next? He starts MMing HYPE by placing bids in addition to his asks. None of his bids have actually filled yet so the bids are notably less aggressive. https://t.co/oWhQAMWAfr

HYPE will be a top 10 coin in 2025, so a hypothetical 10% of supply for incentives next year will actually be a $4b+ wealth effect.

But sure, go ahead and try to farm "the next Hyperliquid" instead of the real Hyperliquid.

@Insayneth @GeormanZ I agree, the timing is not ideal. But my point still stands, a single seller shouldn't be able to single handedly nuke the price (and it hasn't).

The bigger question I have is, is he done after the last 14k hype in his sell wallet gets cleared out?

TBH, sell shaming is something I wish we had less of on CT.

Instead, let’s talk about a 9 fig OG SOL whale buying the dip with only 10% of their SOL stack.

The capital rotation to Hyperliquid is just beginning.

Hyperliquid

If you bought HYPE 3 weeks ago and held until today, you would also be up 17x but without any utility or CEX listings.
